com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.face

Class FacialProcessing

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.face.FacialProcessing

  • public class FacialProcessing
extends java.lang.Object
    The FacialProcessing class is used to execute the facial feature scanning on an image as well as performing facial recognition queries.

    The facial features scanning include:

    • Face Detection
    • Blink Detection
    • Smile Detection
    • Gaze Tracking
    • Face Orientation
    The facial processing features are exposed in a post processing model so that any image, either a video stream or static image, may be processed and if faces are detected, then face data may be extracted and acted upon. Images must be formatted as YUV or bitmap.

    The processing framework may be configured by setting one of two modes to optimize the image scanning process to reduce processing time or increase accuracy. The modes are FP_MODE_STILL and FP_MODE_VIDEO.

    FP_MODE_STILL is the most accurate scanning mode and is typically used for still images and low frame rate video frames. FP_MODE_VIDEO is the most optimized scanning mode and is typically used for processing high frame rate video and camera preview frames. In this mode, the first frame is completely scanned and any faces detected are then tracked in each subsequent frame. Then on every fifteenth frame, the entire image will be scanned again and the process repeated until no further frames are input. Face tracking consumes two thirds fewer cycles to process than a full image scan.

    Another way to reduce the facial processing overhead is to instruct the framework to limit the data set you wish to extract from each face. This is done by passing an EnumSet of all the facial features you want processed in the getFaceData() method. By default, the framework will generate the complete data set for all faces by simply calling the getFaceData with no parameters. The feature enum constants are as follows:

    • FACE_RECT
    • FACE_COORDINATES
    • FACE_SMILE
    • FACE_GAZE
    • FACE_BLINK
    • FACE_ORIENTATION
    • FACE_IDENTIFICATION
    Objects of this class cannot be cloned. Facial Processing class is not thread safe, hence this class is implemented as a singleton. When the facial processing object is no longer needed, call the release() function to dispose of the object. For sample code, please refer to the sample applications that highlight how to integrate the facial processing and facial recognition features into your application.

      • clone

      • isFeatureSupported

        public static boolean isFeatureSupported(FacialProcessing.FEATURE_LIST featureId)
        Use this method to determine if an facial processing feature is supported by the device at runtime. If the feature is not supported then use fall-back functionality or disable the dependent feature in the application.
        Parameters:
        featureId - Features will have defined constants through the enum FEATURE_LIST that can be used for this method. Constant name will include the prefix "FEATURE" so as to be easily recognizable.
        Returns:
        true if the feature is supported, else false.

      • getInstance

        public static FacialProcessing getInstance()
        Creates a new facial processing object and loads the necessary libraries needed to scan and process images for facial data. However, if an instance of the object is already in use, then null is returned. You must call release() when you are done using the facial processing object.
        Returns:
        instance of FacialProcessing else returns null if instantiation fails or an instance is already in use.

      • normalizeCoordinates

        public void normalizeCoordinates(int surfaceWidth,
                        int surfaceHeight)
        Normalizes/scales the co-ordinates to the desired dimension. Call this method in case the display dimension is different from the frame/image dimension passed through setFrame() or setBitmap() methods. If this method is not called, then normalization is not performed. This method should be invoked once for every getInstance(), and anytime the display dimensions change.
        Parameters:
        surfaceWidth - the width of the display surface
        surfaceHeight - the height of the display surface

      • setFrame

        public boolean setFrame(byte[] yuvData,
               int frameWidth,
               int frameHeight,
               boolean isMirrored,
               FacialProcessing.PREVIEW_ROTATION_ANGLE rotationAngle)
        Sets the image to be scanned and processed. The typical use case for this method is for processing camera preview frames where the image is mirrored. The preview data is not always in sync with the display preview and when this happens, the framework needs to know the angle to which the facial data coming from the scan of the preview data should be rotated in order to be in sync with the display. If no rotation is performed, the data will be out of sync with the display. Additionally, if the preview data and the display preview are out of sync rotationally, they may also be of differing resolutions which means the facial data must also be normalized to the display resolution.
        Parameters:
        yuvData - The image to be processed in a byte array.
        frameWidth - The width of the image
        frameHeight - The height of the image
        isMirrored - Allows you to specify if the image being passed in is mirrored or not. Set to true if the image is mirrored and false otherwise.
        PREVIEW_ROTATION_ANGLE - The angle to which the facial data will be rotated in a clockwise direction. Pass in ROT_0 if no rotation is required.
        Returns:
        returns false if image data is not processed, true otherwise.

      • setBitmap

        public boolean setBitmap(Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets the static image to be scanned and processed. The typical use case for this method is processing static images. The framework will automatically use the FP_MODE_STILL mode when processing bitmap images so it is not necessary to set the processing mode yourself.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The image to be processed in bitmap format. Any image that needs to be processed has to be converted to bitmap before passing it to this API.
        Returns:
        returns false if image data is not processed, true otherwise.

      • getNumFaces

        public int getNumFaces()
        Use to query the framework for the number of faces detected in the image last input through setFrame() or setBitmap().
        Returns:
        The number of faces detected

      • getFaceData

        public FaceData[] getFaceData()
        Use to request an array of Face objects, one for each face detected in the input image. Use this method to request the calculation of all facial data points. This includes:
        • FACE_RECT
        • FACE_COORDINATES
        • FACE_SMILE
        • FACE_GAZE
        • FACE_BLINK
        • FACE_ORIENTATION
        • FACE_IDENTIFICATION
        Returns:
        Returns an array of Face objects, one for each face detected. If no face is detected then this will return NULL.

      • getFaceData

        public FaceData[] getFaceData(java.util.EnumSet<FacialProcessing.FP_DATA> dataSet)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Use to request an array of Face object, one for each face detected in the input image. Use this method to select the specific facial data points and prevent unwanted data points from being calculated. This will allow for less calculation overhead.
        Parameters:
        faceFeatureData - Desired facial data points are passed as an EnumSet parameter. Use any combination of the following constants as part of the EnumSet:
        • FACE_RECT
        • FACE_COORDINATES
        • FACE_SMILE
        • FACE_GAZE
        • FACE_BLINK
        • FACE_ORIENTATION
        • FACE_IDENTIFICATION
        FACE_RECT is always calculated so it is not necessary to include it in the EnumSet.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of Face objects, one array for each face detected. If no face is detected then this will return NULL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed EnumSet is invalid or null is passed.

      • addPerson

        public int addPerson(int faceIndex)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description: Use this API to add a new person with the corresponding face data to the recognition album. Make sure to call setFrame(byte[] yuvData, int frameWidth, int frameHeight, boolean isMirrored, PREVIEW_ROTATION_ANGLE rotationAngle) or setBitmap(Bitmap bitmap) before calling addPerson(). This API requires a valid faceIndex. The faceIndex is the array index of the face data array for the referenced face. The addPerson method will return a personId if it was successful, otherwise it will return an error code. Adding a new person to the recognition album will be successful if the face data does not match that of any person in the recognition album. To add more faces to an existing person in the recognition album, use the updatePerson(int personId, int faceIndex) method. Adding more faces to an existing person with different illuminations and facial expressions can help to improve the recognition accuracy.
        Parameters:
        faceIndex - - Array index of the FaceData array
        Returns:
        personId - Unique number for each person in the recognition album
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • updatePerson

        public int updatePerson(int personId,
               int faceIndex)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description: Use this API to add additional faces (face data) to an existing person in the recognition album. This API takes in valid personId and a valid faceIndex. The personId is unique identifier for each person in the recognition album you want to update and the faceIndex is the array index of the face data array for the referenced face. The maximum number of faces that can be added to a person is 10.
        Parameters:
        personId - - Unique identifier for each person in the recognition album
        faceIndex - - Array index of the FaceData array
        Returns:
        FacialProcessingConstants.FP_SUCCESS(0) - If the updating a person to the recognition album was successful FacialProcessingConstants.FP_NO_FACE_DETECTED_ERROR(-1) - If no face was detected in the frame FacialProcessingConstants.FP_INTERNAL_ERROR(-2) - If updating a person failed internally or number of faces for that specific PersonId exceeded the limit of 10 faces.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • deletePerson

        public boolean deletePerson(int personId)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description: Use this API to delete a specific person and all its corresponding face data from the recognition album. This API requires a valid personId. Use caution when calling this method as the data will not be recoverable once it has been removed.
        Parameters:
        personId - - The unique number of the person to be deleted from the recognition album
        Returns:
        True - If the given PersonIds were successfully deleted False - If the given PersonIds were NOT successfully deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • resetAlbum

        public boolean resetAlbum()
        Description: Use this API to remove all data from the recognition album. Use caution when calling this API as the data will not be recoverable once it has been removed.
        Returns:
        True - If all users were successfully deleted from the recognition album False - If reseting the recognition album failed

      • serializeRecogntionAlbum

        public byte[] serializeRecogntionAlbum()
        Description: Use this API to convert the recognition album into a byte array so that the application can store the data on a persistent storage memory for later use.
        Returns:
        - A valid byte array of the recognition album or NULL if the serialization failed.

      • deserializeRecognitionAlbum

        public boolean deserializeRecognitionAlbum(byte[] albumBuffer)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description: Use this API to load a serialized recognition album created by the serializeRecogntionAlbum() API, into the facial recognition framework.
        Parameters:
        albumBuffer - - Album data returned by serializeRecogntionAlbum() API
        Returns:
        - TRUE if the album byte array was successfully converted into a recognition album FALSE if the conversion was unsuccessful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • setRecognitionConfidence

        public int setRecognitionConfidence(int confidenceValue)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description: This API sets the threshold value at which the face engine will ignore any face data matches with a confidence value below the set threshold. The threshold ranges in value between 0 to 100. The higher the value, the more discriminating the software will be when filtering out matches.
        Parameters:
        confidenceValue - - An integer value between 0 and 100
        Returns:
        - FacialProcessingConstants.FP_SUCCESS(0)- If the confidence value was set successfully. OR FacialProcessingConstants.FP_CONFIDENCE_OUT_OF_RANGE_ERROR(-4)- If the input confidence value is out of range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getAlbumPersonCount

        public int getAlbumPersonCount()
        Description: Use this API to query the recognition album for the total number of people stored in the recognition album
        Returns:
        -The number of people that have been stored in the recognition album; zero if the album is empty

      • release

        public void release()
        This method will release the facial processor

      • setProcessingMode

        public boolean setProcessingMode(FacialProcessing.FP_MODES mode)
        Use to configure the scanning mode for the facial processing engine. The default mode is FP_MODE_VIDEO.
        Parameters:
        mode - Specify one of two available modes:
        • FP_MODE_VIDEO: This is the most optimized scanning mode and is typically used when processing high frame rate camera preview frames or video
        • FP_MODE_STILL: This is the most accurate scanning mode and is typically used when processing still images or low frame rate video
        Returns:
        true if the mode is set successfully, else false.
